channel.title: Your Test
channel.description:
Hey guys. How do you guys think about the Your Test (mine is STAAR, 1 day finished, just tommorow and I'm done :))? Since I'm in 5th grade, it's coming up on Tuesday - Wednesday. When is yours coming and what do you think about it? My expression:
[img]http://gifsoup.com/view5/2709645/nail-biting-o.gif[/img]
Some quotes:
[quote="arham 4, post:6, topic:437504"][quote author=krackkid link=topic=540209.msg3955734#msg3955734 date=1332727086] [quote author=arham 4 link=topic=540209.msg3955733#msg3955733 date=1332727041] [quote author=krackkid link=topic=540209.msg3955731#msg3955731 date=1332727005] What is a STAAR test? I never heard of it o.o [/quote] It replaces the TAKS and it's harder. [/quote]What is TAKS? [/quote] Texas Association of Knowledge and Skills I think.
What I think:
TORTURE.ALL.KIDS.SILENTLY
STAAR stands for State of Texas Assessments of Academic Readiness
What I think:
STUDENTS.TORTURED.AFTER.AWESOME.RECESS (Or break for you guys. Break = Recess)
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=93_C45t5OC8[/quote]
[quote="krackkid, post:7, topic:437504"]The test are nothing, the hardness etc are a state of mind..They are easy.[/quote]
[quote="Daginith, post:8, topic:437504"]Have fun once you have to take the ACT tests. ;)[/quote]
[quote="Daginith, post:10, topic:437504"][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=540209.msg3955748#msg3955748 date=1332727801] I remember those tests (with a different name) but if you get your entire class to fail it your teacher will get their ass chewed out. [/quote] We called them the ISATs
I live in Illinios (Illinios standardized achievement test)[/quote]
[quote="Frell, post:12, topic:437504"]I took the ACT and didnt read one question of the science part and still landed in the top 75%
[quote author=LilXCj link=topic=540209.msg3956036#msg3956036 date=1332761311] Lol @ Frell not knowing how to calculate percentiles. [/quote] lol I know, I didn't expect to do good and im not surprised I didn't. It was required and it got me out of other tests, and I didn't take highschool seriously until 11th grade
lol[/quote]
[quote="krackkid, post:19, topic:437504"]Florida has the Fcat well did but it was changed because people couldn't do the test :/[/quote]
[quote="Davidi2, post:25, topic:437504"]Here it's called the WASL (Washington assessment of student learning) (pronouced wahsl)
I always crack up when we get to the blue section (math) of the test.
Blue wasl, anyone?[/quote]
[quote="Ix Soulcist xI, post:26, topic:437504"]It's a bit "hit-on" for our state, I suppose, a lot of people take it so damn seriously, I know why, but eh. It's called the SAT for us in Georgia.[/quote]
[quote="reyx7, post:34, topic:437504"]We have the MSA (Maryland standardized assessment) and I've received 100% on multiple of the english ones them. Then another required one (M something something T) was just as easy. As for the PSAT (still a sophomore) I came in the 3rd percentile for math.[/quote]
[quote="arham 4, post:37, topic:437504"]Lemme translate all your test things.
[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=540209.msg3955990#msg3955990 date=1332755649] Here it's called the WASL (Washington assessment of student learning) (pronouced wahsl)
I always crack up when we get to the blue section (math) of the test.
Blue wasl, anyone? [/quote]
Weird Assignments by Stupid Losers
[quote author=amy_webb link=topic=540209.msg3955979#msg3955979 date=1332753985] I've had the last two weeks of school full of SACs for different classes, English SAC (which was an essay on a stupid book), a Media SAC, an Accounting SAC (i have another one tomorrow), ect. But i'm not stressing out about anything, basically just winging it all. [/quote]
Stupid Assignments in Classes
[quote author=krackkid link=topic=540209.msg3955800#msg3955800 date=1332731264] Florida has the Fcat well did but it was changed because people couldn't do the test :/ [/quote]
Freaking Curriculum Always Tortures (us)
[quote author=reyx7 link=topic=540209.msg3956393#msg3956393 date=1332797629] We have the MSA (Maryland standardized assessment) and I've received 100% on multiple of the english ones them. Then another required one (M something something T) was just as easy. As for the PSAT (still a sophomore) I came in the 3rd percentile for math. [/quote]
Messy Stupid Assignments
[size=36pt]:D[/size][/quote]
[quote="Travas, post:44, topic:437504"]I actually just took the PLAN test today, it's a practice ACT test[/quote]

item.title: Your Test
item.dc:creator: @DEFET DEFET
item.description:
@DEFET wrote:

sat/act

act is easy as fuck

nopenopenopenope

Read full topic

item.title: Your Test
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Here we had the SAT and ACT, no special names or anything

My mom made me start taking the practice tests(PSAT here) when I was in 9th grade and they definitely help you get a feel for what you’ll be experiencing on the real thing. Once you’ve taken it you’ll laugh at how nervous you were Unless of course you weren’t actually prepared… :o

Read full topic

item.title: Your Test
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Hey guys. How do you guys think about the Your Test (mine is STAAR, 1 day finished, just tommorow and I’m done :))? Since I’m in 5th grade, it’s coming up on Tuesday - Wednesday. When is yours coming and what do you think about it? My expression:

Some quotes:

[quote=“arham 4, post:6, topic:437504”][quote author=krackkid link=topic=540209.msg3955734#msg3955734 date=1332727086]

What is a STAAR test? I never heard of it o.o

It replaces the TAKS and it’s harder.
[/quote]What is TAKS?

Texas Association of Knowledge and Skills I think.

What I think:

TORTURE.ALL.KIDS.SILENTLY

STAAR stands for State of Texas Assessments of Academic Readiness

What I think:

STUDENTS.TORTURED.AFTER.AWESOME.RECESS (Or break for you guys. Break = Recess)

Your Test

The test are nothing, the hardness etc are a state of mind…They are easy.

Your Test

Have fun once you have to take the ACT tests.

[quote=“Daginith, post:10, topic:437504”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=540209.msg3955748#msg3955748 date=1332727801]
I remember those tests (with a different name) but if you get your entire class to fail it your teacher will get their ass chewed out.
[/quote]
We called them the ISATs

I live in Illinios (Illinios standardized achievement test)[/quote]

[quote=“Frell, post:12, topic:437504”]I took the ACT and didnt read one question of the science part and still landed in the top 75%

Lol @ Frell not knowing how to calculate percentiles.

lol I know, I didn’t expect to do good and im not surprised I didn’t. It was required and it got me out of other tests, and I didn’t take highschool seriously until 11th grade

lol[/quote]

Your Test

Florida has the Fcat well did but it was changed because people couldn’t do the test

[quote=“Davidi2, post:25, topic:437504”]Here it’s called the WASL (Washington assessment of student learning) (pronouced wahsl)

I always crack up when we get to the blue section (math) of the test.

Blue wasl, anyone?[/quote]

Your Test

It’s a bit “hit-on” for our state, I suppose, a lot of people take it so damn seriously, I know why, but eh. It’s called the SAT for us in Georgia.

Your Test

We have the MSA (Maryland standardized assessment) and I’ve received 100% on multiple of the english ones them. Then another required one (M something something T) was just as easy. As for the PSAT (still a sophomore) I came in the 3rd percentile for math.

[quote=“arham 4, post:37, topic:437504”]Lemme translate all your test things.

Here it’s called the WASL (Washington assessment of student learning) (pronouced wahsl)

I always crack up when we get to the blue section (math) of the test.

Blue wasl, anyone?

Weird Assignments by Stupid Losers

I’ve had the last two weeks of school full of SACs for different classes, English SAC (which was an essay on a stupid book), a Media SAC, an Accounting SAC (i have another one tomorrow), ect. But i’m not stressing out about anything, basically just winging it all.

Stupid Assignments in Classes

Florida has the Fcat well did but it was changed because people couldn’t do the test

Freaking Curriculum Always Tortures (us)

We have the MSA (Maryland standardized assessment) and I’ve received 100% on multiple of the english ones them. Then another required one (M something something T) was just as easy. As for the PSAT (still a sophomore) I came in the 3rd percentile for math.

Messy Stupid Assignments

Your Test

I actually just took the PLAN test today, it’s a practice ACT test

Read full topic
